Hello

Digital Prototyping

Why do we prototype?

To test a value proposition

Your ability to prove value to your users and give them a reason to buy into your product or service.

...so let's make that testable

User Experience Metrics

Google's HEART framework.

H

Happiness

measures of user attitudes

E

Engagement

level of user involvement

A

Adoption

does your target audience want this?

R

Retention

can we keep them?

T

Task Success

is the experience intuitive and effective?

Why do we prototype in code?

When a personalized user journey is critical to evaluating the experience.

Example: booking a flight

When the system plays an active role in the experience.

Motion Studies

The Technical POC

Technology-driven protoypes.

Tools

Selecting the right apps, code languages etc.

The 10 minute test

If you can't figure out how it works in 10 minutes run away.

10 minute test questions

  • Is there good documentation?
  • Is there training?
  • Are there examples or starter templates I can work with?
  • Can I pick this up and make progress in 10 min?

Wordpress and the famous 5 minute install

My recommendation for the beginner

Using Apps - Sketch & Framer

My recommendation for the intermediate/expert

Hand coding with Bootstrap

UI Libraries give you a toolkit of components and layout grids to build with. They require basic html, css and javascript to work with what comes out of the box.

If you've got more .css or javascript experience you can go deeper into customizing the look and feel or the functionality.

The Do's & Don'ts of Prototyping in Code

Don't forget about paper prototyping!

Don't run directly to code. Pick the appropriate medium for your prototype. Code has a production cost.

Manage expectations

Including your own

When presenting to users, always lead the conversation by framing expectations on the available functionality and the level of fidelity in the prototype.

To manage your own expectations, be reasonable about the level of fidelity and functionality required for a successful prototype.

Don't overcomplicate it!

As simple as possible, but not simpler.

Don't let the design or technology get away from you.

Digital tools can accelerate production but they can also pull you into trivial details.

Read this book

Prototyping, A Practitioner's Guide By Todd Zaki Warfel

Thank you
